name: Taj Mahal
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the southern bank of the Yamuna river. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Agra Fort
description: Another UNESCO World Heritage Site in Agra, the Agra Fort is a historical fort and the main residence of the emperors of the Mughal Dynasty. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Fatehpur Sikri
description: The historic city of Fatehpur Sikri was once the capital of the Mughal Empire and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Ajanta Caves
description: A series of 29 rock-cut caves, the Ajanta Caves are renowned for their Buddhist art and are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Ellora Caves
description: The Ellora Caves are an extensive complex of rock-cut monasteries and temples, and are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Sun Temple, Konark
description: The Sun Temple at Konark is a UNESCO World Heritage Site famous for its monumental representation of the chariot of the Sun God. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Khajuraho Group of Monuments
description: Famous for their erotic sculptures, the Khajuraho Group of Monuments is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Group of Monuments at Hampi
description: Hampi is the remains of the last great Hindu kingdom in South India and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Qutb Minar and its Monuments
description: The Qutb Minar complex is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and contains the tallest minaret made of bricks. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Red Fort Complex
description: The Red Fort Complex served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Humayun's Tomb
description: Humayun's Tomb is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Great Living Chola Temples
description: These temples represent the Chola architectural and artistic mastery and are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Mahabalipuram Monuments
description: Famous for rock-cut temples, the Mahabalipuram Group of Monuments is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Kaziranga National Park
description: Kaziranga National Park is home to two-thirds of the world's one-horned rhinoceroses and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Keoladeo National Park
description: Keoladeo National Park is a famous avifauna sanctuary and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Manas Wildlife Sanctuary
description: Manas Wildlife Sanctuary is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, a Project Tiger Reserve, and an Elephant Reserve. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Sundarbans National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Sundarbans National Park is known for its population of Bengal tigers and mangrove forests. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Western Ghats
description: The Western Ghats are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the world's eight 'hottest hotspots' of biological diversity. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Nanda Devi and Valley of Flowers National Parks
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Nanda Devi and the Valley of Flowers National Parks are known for their scenic beauty and rare biodiversity. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Mountain Railways of India
location: Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Himachal Pradesh
description: The Mountain Railways of India, including the Darjeeling and Nilgiri mountain railways, are UNESCO World Heritage Sites. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Rani-ki-Vav (The Queen’s Stepwell)
description: Rani-ki-Vav is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the finest examples of stepwell architecture. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Hill Forts of Rajasthan
description: The Hill Forts of Rajasthan are a UNESCO World Heritage Site comprising six majestic forts in Rajasthan. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: The Architectural Work of Le Corbusier
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Le Corbusier's work in Chandigarh is considered a masterpiece of modernist architecture. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Nalanda Mahavihara
description: Nalanda Mahavihara, an ancient seat of learning, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Buddhist Monuments at Sanchi
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Sanchi is known for its stupas, monasteries, and sculptural gateways. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Rock Shelters of Bhimbetka
description: Bhimbetka is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, featuring ancient rock shelters and cave paintings. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Champaner-Pavagadh Archaeological Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Champaner-Pavagadh is a historic city and a significant archaeological site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus
description: Formerly known as Victoria Terminus, this is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a fine example of Victorian Gothic Revival architecture. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Elephanta Caves
description: The Elephanta Caves are rock-cut cave temples dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva and are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Jantar Mantar
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Jantar Mantar in Jaipur is a collection of astronomical instruments built in the 18th century. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: The Jantar Mantar of Delhi
description: A 1724 astronomical observatory built by Maharaja Jai Singh II of Jaipur. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Churches and Convents of Goa
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this is a group of Catholic religious buildings from the Portuguese colonial period. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Great Himalayan National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the park is known for its biodiversity and scenic beauty in the Western Himalayas. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Khangchendzonga National Park
description: The park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its spiritual significance and biodiversity. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Mountain Railways of Darjeeling
description: A part of the Mountain Railways of India, Darjeeling is famous for its scenic toy train and railway system. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Mahabodhi Temple Complex
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this temple marks the location where Siddhartha Gautama attained enlightenment. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Victorian and Art Deco Ensembles of Mumbai
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the architectural ensembles of Mumbai reflect a blend of Victorian and Art Deco styles. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Jaipur City
description: The entire city of Jaipur has been designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site due to its urban planning and architecture. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.

name: Kakatiya Rudreshwara (Ramappa) Temple
description: The Ramappa Temple is the first UNESCO World Heritage Site from Telangana, known for its exquisite craftsmanship. It is a key heritage site in India and attracts millions of tourists every year.
